turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: You little fuck. Let him go. I'll drop you right here.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Okay, just calm down. He could hurt us, brother. He could ruin the whole thing.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Let him go or I will deliver you, right now.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: You won't do it Connor, you won't. You love me man.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: You guys?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: We're here brother.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: You gotta keep going.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Connor, is that you?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Mother, is that you?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Is that worthless brother of your there? I want you both ta hear this.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Ma, what's wrong?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: It's all your fault. Both you little bastards. I was a fool to believe you would bring me any peace. The day your Da left us when you were almost too young to remember, he said the two of you would do me right and make me proud, but he was wrong and I got nothin' ta live for.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Mother, what are you sayin'? You're talkin' crazy here.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: I finally found your Da's army revolver, Connor.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: What the hell are you doin' with Da's gun!?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: What?! What are you doin'?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: I want ta tell ya one last thing before I pull the trigger.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Pull the trigger?! Have ya lost it woman?! Now just calm down here.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: No ma! No!

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: BLAME...

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: How's Uncle Sibeal?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Well, you know how it is with him. Always complainin' he's never turnin' a profit on St. Patty's. Whole damn family goes down there with no money, cause we know he can't bear ta charge us.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Well, we tried ta make friends and she gave me a shot ta the nuts.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: What... the dirty bitch! I hope ya trounced her a good one!

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Well, I didn't but...

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Yeah, we promise.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Well, there's my boys.  Shit. I gotta go. Looks like I caused a ruckus with that shot. Half the damn neighborhood is comin'.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Still bickerin' over that, huh?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Come on, ma. Out with it. Who came out first?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: All right, I suppose you have the right ta know.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: You guys are not under oath, here. I am assuming you knew these two guys from before, huh?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: We... met them last night.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: They had some pretty interesting bandages. Know anything about that?

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: So, how is it that you guys are fluent in Russian?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: We paid attention in school.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Know any other languages?

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Well, we could try the bag over the head thing. Walk you right out the front.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Our mother can see through bags.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Well, the light caught the side of his face for a second. And it looked like he had a gray beard, maybe... late fifties, early sixties.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: So you're telling me it was one guy with six guns? A-and he was a senior fucking citizen?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: I think it's better if we find this man before he finds us again.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: I'll see what I can do. How do I get in touch with you?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: We're going to hit Poppa Joe tonight, right in the comfort of his own home. Then we move on to New York. It's getting a bit hot for us here.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Be careful.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: I'll call you tonight, afterwards.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: We're alive.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: An F.B.I. agent came by the bar. He left me his c-c, he left me his c-c, he left me this.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: We're going to turn ourselves in. It was self defense.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: y-y-yeah that's what he said.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Hold this shit for us, Doc. We'll be comin back for it when we get out.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Would someone please come over here and...

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Fuck!

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: me up the...

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Ass!

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: I do believe the Monsignor finally got a point.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Aye.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Hey Murphy?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Aye.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: How many feminists does it take to screw in a light bulb?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: How many?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Two. One ta screw it in and one ta suck my cock.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: No fuckin' hot water man. That...

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Shut it. It's Ma.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Aaaww, shit!... evil woman!

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Lord have mercy. That was a good one ma.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Oh, Jesus.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: I gave him his first lesson in sensitivity toward the fairer sex just today.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Don't even do it, ya bastard.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: He got beat up by a girl.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: If that was a girl I want ta see some papers. She had ta be just preoperative for Christ sakes.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: All right, love ya ma. Listen, before ya go just give us the goods, eh?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Yeah. It's been twenty-seven years.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: "What do we tell him about the guns and money?"

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: "We just got up and left. Bum musta rolled them before the police got there."

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Okay. We're ready.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: A p-penny saved is worth two in the bush.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Don't c-cross the road if ya can't get out of the kitchen.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Listen fellas, Y'know he's got 'til this week's end. Ya don't have ta be hard asses, do ya?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Yeah, it's St. Patty's day. Everyone's Irish tonight. Now, why don't ya pull up a stool and have a drink with us?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: "Now, that wasn't too polite, was it?"

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: "I'm afraid we can't let that one go, Ivan."

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: How do you think he figured all this out without talking to us?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Italian.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: I have no idea. Maybe someone saw and talked.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: German.  Not in our neighborhood, man. A hundred percent Irish. No one talks to cops. Period.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Spanish.  Then I guess he's just real... real good.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Absolutely not.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: No pictures, either.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Destroy all that which is evil...

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: ...so that which is good may flourish

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Know what we need, man?... some rope.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Charlie Bronson's always got rope.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Yeah, these guys always got a lot of rope strapped around em in the movies and they always end up using it.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Oh, you've lost it, haven't ya?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: I'm serious.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Me too. That's stupid. Name one thing we're gonna need it for.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: I don't know they just always need it.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: What is all this "they" shit? This ain't a movie.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Is that right, Rambo?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: All right, get the stupid fuckin' rope.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Nervous?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: A bit.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Me, too.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: See. I told you there'd be a shaft.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Just like on TV.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Where the fuck are you going?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: We'll find it. Just calm down.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: No, fuck you. This rope is bullshit. I'm sweatin' my ass off draggin' this stupid thing around. Must weigh 30 pounds.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: We're doing some serious shit here. Now, get a hold of yourself, asshole.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Asshole!? I'm not the rope-totin' Charlie Bronson wanna-be that's getting' us lost!

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Sh, sh! Fuck you!

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: That was way easier than I thought.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Aye.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: On TV ya always get that asshole that jumps behind the couch.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Yeah, and ya gotta shoot at him for ten minutes.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Oh, we're good man.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Yes, we are.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Nine bodies.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Oh, you're good. What were you gonna do? Laugh the last three to death, funny man?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Mafiosos getting caught with 20 kilos and walkin' on bail the same day.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Little girls catchin' stray bullets in their heads, playin' hopscotch in their front yards. And everyone thinks the same thing... Someone should just go kill those motherfuckers.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Kill em all. Admit it, even you've thought about it.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Where are you goin'?  Did you tell him?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Then what the fuck?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Who did you kill?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Holy shit. Who? How many?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: So what do you think?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: I'm strangely comfortable with it.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: We've teamed up with a sex offender.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: So, when are you getting a plastic fuck doll?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Give the guy a shot.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Rocco, this is the real deal. We must kill without hesitation, without guilt or remorse. Evil man, dead man.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: There he goes.  Okay, gentlemen. Are we ready to bring this man into the light? Are we ready to truly do the work of the Lord?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: A-fuckin'-men!

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: That's the guy that got us off the hook with the "Checkov" thing.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: And he is one smart man.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: He isn't to be touched.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: He's a good man.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Now, you will receive us.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: We do not ask for your poor or your hungry.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: We do not want your tired and sick.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: It is your corrupt we claim.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: It is your evil, who will be sought by us.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: With every breath we shall hunt them down.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Each day we will spill their blood till it rains down from the skies.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Do not kill, do not rape, do not steal. These are principles which every man of every faith can embrace.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: These are not polite suggestions. They are codes of behavior and those that ignore them will pay the dearest cost.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: There are varying degrees of evil. We urge you lesser forms of filth  Not to push the bounds and cross over into true corruption... into our domain.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: For if you do, there will come the day when you look behind you and see we three. And on that day you will reap it.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: And we will send you to whatever God you wish.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: I prefer to be called Rozengurtle by men.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Okay then... let's get ya started.

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Okay, just cut off as much fat as you can as it goes by and the rule of thumb here is...

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Rule of thumb?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Do you know where that term comes from? In the early 1900's it was legal for men to beat their wives as long as they used a stick no wider than their thumb.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: I knew you two pricks would give me problems. Give me shit cause I'm a woman. I'm not gonna take your male dominance bullshit!

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Oh, come on now Rozengurtle. I was just tryin' ta get a rise outta ya.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Baumgartner sound Irish to you, fuck face?

turns.speaker: CONNOR
turns.text: Now look Rozengurtle, we're sorry. Just relax.

turns.speaker: DOLLY
turns.text: Holy shit. You're the first one that's ever got that.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Yeah, well... I'm an expert in name- ology.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: And number three, Dolly.

turns.speaker: DOLLY
turns.text: Uh... two shooters!

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Fan-fuckin-tastic!

turns.speaker: DOLLY
turns.text: So, what do we do now?

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: That depends. You either do your job or get ethical.

turns.speaker: DOLLY
turns.text: She was in here when it went down.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Can she I.D. them?

turns.speaker: DOLLY
turns.text: They were wearing masks.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Of course they were. How many?

turns.speaker: DOLLY
turns.text: Three.

turns.speaker: DOLLY
turns.text: Only two did the shooting.  So what are you thinking, Russian retaliation?

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Nah, too quick half their infrastructure got taken out at the Copley plaza. Besides, if you're a hitter, you're either working for the Russians or the Italians. There's no riding the fence. Our little theory from last night just got blown to shit. Something... new is going on here.

turns.speaker: DOLLY
turns.text: Maybe the three of them had something in common.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: No. This guy is big time.  These two are street-walking scum.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: And it's the same story over here. Why the crossover?  Theories.

turns.speaker: DOLLY
turns.text: That's just fucking weird. I have no idea.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: The shooter knew these guys, huh?

turns.speaker: DOLLY
turns.text: How do you figure?

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Friends, Gentlemen. They were friends.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: No! Fuck you! You start getting excited! We gotta fucking go!

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Rocco!

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Where's my cat?

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: I killed your fuckin' cat, you druggie bitch!

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: You... oh god, why?

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: I felt it would bring closure to our relationship!

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: You killed my... my...

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Your what?! Your fuckin' what?!

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: My, my...

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Your what, bitch? I'll shoot myself in the head, you can tell me that cats name! Go ahead... Your what? Your precious little...

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: Pee...Per...Man.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Peeperman? WRONG? What color was it?!!!

turns.speaker: DONNA
turns.text: It was... It was...

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Male or female, bitch?!!

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: So what are you thinkin' here?

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Really want to know?

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: So Duffy, got any theories to go with that... tie.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: These guys were pros. I think they were coming for one target, the fag man, he was the...

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: The what man?

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: The fat man.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Well, Freud was right. So you think they came for the fag man, huh? And what do you base this upon?

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: He was the only one done right. Two in the back of the head.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: And the pennies?

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: New hitman wants to leave his mark

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: That's a possibility. Y'know you Boston cops are perking up. That's two sound theories in one day, neither of which deal with abnormally sized men.  Another possibility is that they were placed there with religious intent.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Yeah. Some cultures still put pennies in the eyes of the dead, or silver.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: The Greeks. The Italians.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: The Sicilians.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: The two bullets went in here, through the top of the skull, criss-crossed and exited through the eyeballs. This one clue tells us three distinct facts. Number one... Duffy.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: They shot him at a downward angle.  They put him on his knees.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Excellent! Number two. Greenly.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Now stay with me, boys. What did they do to make two such identical wounds? Did one guy put him on his knees, pop a cap in, sit him back up and shoot him again the same way? No. Two men of similar height dropped this guy down, each put some iron to his head and boom! That's all she fuckin' wrote!

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: What about one guy with two guns?

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Possible, but unlikely. The angles are too extreme. A guy holding two guns to the back of your head is gonna shoot straight ahead. He wouldn't cock out his elbows, makes no sense. Besides, you telling me one guy came in here and killed eight men with eight extremely well aimed shots in just a few seconds? No way. Had to be at least two.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Now, what is this going to look like to those who do not know what I just told you?

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: It's gonna look like the bad guys are killing each other.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: And is there an American, shit is there a man seated among us that hasn't thought about it many times, let's just put them all on an island, give them guns and let them kill each other. This is our wet dream come true. You can expect federal and local law enforcement to go only deep enough to satisfy the law, then bury it from here on out.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Allow me to enlighten you gentlemen to the protocol of the porno industry, as I'm sure you've never been in one of these places before. A man goes into the booth, puts the money in the slot. The dancer gets it on the other side. She hits the button, door goes up, now there is only glass between you and it's  little fireman time.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: No way they could have seen it?

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Those doors were down... which means this. They looked down in through the peep hole, saw these guys and opened the doors from the inside. Pop, pop, pop, right through the glass. Why?

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Jesus. I just can't think anymore. That scene over at the coffee shop today tapped me out.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: A guy went nuts over off of Commonwealth today. Shot three guys to death in a coffee shop in broad daylight. Fled the scene. Don't have much on him.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Why was I not informed of this?

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: These two fucking scenes are related. Too many coincidences. Same day? Five hours apart? Dead mobsters on both scenes. Now, why did he kill the bartender?

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Crime of passion. He just went nuts. He would have shot everyone in here. He just ran out of bullets.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Duffy. This look like a fucking post office to you? This guy came in here with intent. Maybe he didn't know exactly what he was gonna do but he had a pretty good idea. The bartender wasn't a fucking accident.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Well, we didn't get any help on that. A lot of people saw it. Nobody's talking.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Fucking figures. Look, are you guys seeing the pattern here? We got big questions at both of these crime scenes, with no answers. WHY did they kill the guys in the other two booths? WHY did he do the bartender? It would seem unnecessary, even stupid.  God, I hate cold crime scenes! I'm fucking leaving now. And do me a favor, tell me when the next guy dies, cause these guys are not done yet.

turns.speaker: GREENLY
turns.text: That's one big fuckin' shoe!... and think about it. Of all the ways to kill a guy, crushin' him to death. That's very particular. You don't get many of those. I dunno. I feel something big here. I wouldn't be surprised if we see more of these turning up.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Brilliant. So now we got a Huge guy theory and Serial crusher theory. Top fucking notch.  What's your name?

turns.speaker: GREENLY
turns.text: Detective Greenly. Who the fuck are you?

turns.speaker: GREENLY
turns.text: Who the...

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Twist of lemon!

turns.speaker: GREENLY
turns.text: Chief, what the fuck is this?

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Sweet-n-low!

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: He's struck again, hasn't he, Greenly?

turns.speaker: GREENLY
turns.text: Why do you always disrespect me like that?

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Respect is earned, Greenly, never given. Guys like you should have to follow me around squabbling for the scraps from my table.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: How many bodies, Greenly?

turns.speaker: GREENLY
turns.text: Eight.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: While Greenly's getting coffee, anybody else want anything?

turns.speaker: GREENLY
turns.text: Shit! Shit!

turns.speaker: GREENLY
turns.text: Uh.  Shit, I, uh...

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: It tells us that he was the last to die. All these men  Were carrying. They came in, dropped all in seconds and then took their time with fag man. Didn't they, Duffy?!  They sure as fuck did!

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: After talking to the dancer we know that their mark was the guy in the middle booth. After she watches them whack him, she passes out.  Why the two extra victims?

turns.speaker: GREENLY
turns.text: Witness?

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: No way they could have seen it.

turns.speaker: GREENLY
turns.text: They weren't related. The guy used a 38. No pennies. Totally amateur.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Who were the victims?

turns.speaker: GREENLY
turns.text: A couple of peons for the mob and...

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Oh that's just BEAUTIFUL! All the scumbags in the quiet city of Boston start dropping dead and you think it's unrelated?! Greenly, the day I want the Boston Police doing my thinking for me, I will have a fucking tag on my toe! Now, get me a squad car and get me over there. I want the crime scene photos and any witness statements. NOW!

turns.speaker: GREENLY
turns.text: What if it was just one guy with six guns?

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Why don't you let me do the thinking, huh, genius?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: What the...?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: I got it ta my head now. I got it ta my head now.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Oh my god!

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Oh, she's quite proud of herself.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Okay, seriously, both you listen ta me now.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: It's only 11:00 here boys so I got lot's more drinkin' ta do with your worthless relatives down at the Anvil.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Just called ta torture us did ya?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: But he's been havin' himself a nip or two as well... Been up the waitress' skirt all night, poor girl.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Well you tell him ta take it easy with that. He's gotta learn ta respect women the way Connor does.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Promise me boys.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: We promise.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Right now.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Don't kill me. Oh shit, please no. I'm Rocco. I'm the funny man!... the funny man... the funny.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: This is some heavy shit. This is like Lone Ranger-heavy man. Fuck it! There's so much shit that pisses me off. You guys should recruit 'cause I am sick and fuckin' tired of walkin' down the street waitin' for one of these assholes to get me, y'know?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Hallelujah, Jaffar.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: So you're not just talkin' mob guys. You're talkin' anyone, right? Even like pimps and drug dealers and all that shit?

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Well fuck, you guys could do this every day.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: We're like 7-Eleven. We ain't always doing business, but we're always open.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: You fuckin' guys. You ruined me. I'm fuckin' done. Permanent package boy.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Who says that? You could take credit on it.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: What are you serious?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Yeah, fuck it. If you think about it, it's all you can do really. You can't tell him it was us. Go in braggin' and shit.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Hey. You don't know that shit for sure.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Oh, Jesus. You're such a fuckin' retard!

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Fuck you!

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Use your brain for once. Is it so unbelievable they don't care about you? You are fuckin' dead, you go in there today. Dead!

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Oh yeah. You two fuckin' Micks know what's going on, huh?  Fuck you!

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Fuck it! What kind of flowers ya want at your funeral? Ya dumb Wop. This is the last time I'll see you. Bye-bye ya stupid son of a bitch.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: I'll be back at 9:00.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Hey Murph.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Roc. You okay?

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Yeah. Anybody call for me?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: No. You sure you're okay?

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: I'm fuckin' fine.  Catch you on the flip side.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Hey, Murph.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Roc. You okay?

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Yeah. Anybody call for me?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: No. You sure you're okay?

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: I'm fuckin' fine.  Catch you on the flip side.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Hurry the fuck up!

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: This is some crazy shit, man!

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Those cocksuckers sold me out!

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Those rat fucks! All of them were all laughing at me man!

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: You sure you killed them?
